item.title: ANTI-SKID SYSTEM CHANNELS – (ONE CHANNEL AND ASSOCIATED BRAKE INOPERATIVE – DEACTIVATED BY CAPPING THE LINE)

remarks.para: One channel and associated brake may be inoperative (brake deactivated or line capped) provided:

numlitem.para: Brake is deactivated by an acceptable procedure, and
AOM Ch. 5.1 Brake Deactivated or Line Capped decrements are applied for the selected procedure.

note.para: Dispatch is not allowed with a brake deactivated and the anti-skid system inoperative.

operation.para: (Use appropriate One Brake Deactivated worksheet respective to engine type, in Chapter 5.1 of the AOM.)

numlitem.para: After takeoff, the landing gear must remain extended for a minimum of two minutes to allow the wheel to spin down prior to gear retraction.
An additional 500 lbs. of fuel must be added to account for additional drag of leaving landing gear extended.
See the destination airport landing chart for the runway limit weight for landing with one wheel brake deactivated.
Consult the Quick Turn-Around Limit chart with one wheel brake deactivated, if necessary.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.

note.para: Must be operative for dispatch into LPB, UIO, BOG, GUA, TGU.

numlitem.para: Downgrade aircraft category dispatch status to CAT 3a.
Takeoff Performance limit weight (lower of runway/climb limit weight) reduced by:
Landing Weight Reduction – see destination airport landing chart for Max Landing Weight With One Brake Deactivated.
Additional 500 lbs. of fuel required for planning purposes.
Flaps 1 and 20 takeoff operation is not allowed.
No operation with Improved Climb Performance is allowed.
If "OCA" is present on the airport analysis page and is greater than the level of height, contact Flight Control for alternate airport analysis data.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.

placard.para: Placard Anti-Skid Light "ANTI-SKID SYSTEM CHANNEL #_____ INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
